title: Improving Multi-turn Task Completion in Task-Oriented Dialog Systems via Prompt Chaining and Fine-Grained Feedback
author: Moghis Fereidouni (University of Kentucky), Md Sajid Ahmed (Independent Researcher), Adib Mosharrof (University of Kentucky), A.B. Siddique (University of Kentucky), ...
relevance_why: The use of prompt chaining and fine-grained feedback mechanisms could inform future developments in generative audio models, enhancing dialogue interactions in audio-based applications.
background: Task-oriented dialog systems assist users in completing multi-turn tasks through natural language, requiring accurate API calls and adaptation to new domains.
contribution: This paper introduces the RealTOD framework to enhance task-oriented dialog systems by enabling zero-shot domain adaptation and improving API accuracy via feedback mechanisms.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods like AutoTOD and SimpleTOD rely heavily on human-curated examples or extensive fine-tuning for each domain.
technical_comparison.novelty: The proposed framework utilizes prompt chaining for example generation without the need for curated data and integrates fine-grained feedback to correct API calls in real-time.

key_innovation: Combines two-step prompt generation with automatic verification of API calls to enhance performance and reduce the reliance on manually annotated datasets.
real_world_impact: The framework is expected to significantly increase the adaptability and efficiency of task-oriented dialog systems, making them applicable across various domains without extensive manual intervention.
limitations: The evaluation is limited to four large language models and may not generalize to all emerging models.

new_terms.prompt chaining: **Prompt chaining** refers to the method of sequentially linking prompts to facilitate the generation of contextually relevant outputs without prior examples.
new_terms.fine-grained feedback: **Fine-grained feedback** is a mechanism that provides detailed corrective signals for specific errors detected in generated responses or API calls.

open_sourcing: Source code will be released upon acceptance.
